body:
Yup, I've put a comment on your PR. We can merge yours first and then this one (to cleanup fineract-provider test dependencies too).

Update: let's close this one. I just approved yours.

@vorburger I just ran tests locally for fineract-provider and it was complaining about the missing restassured dependencies. Other than that I think this is good.

Update: Ah, just saw that you removed those classes that referenced restassured. Ignore above then.
Duplicate of #1490 and #1491
@vorburger #1465 and #1489 are included here. Just waiting for the build to finish...
@vidakovic do you want to review this one, and merge if it LGTY?
LGTM
@vorburger, sure. kindly drop me a comment here once #1486 is merged. I shall re work on this PR

> LGTM 

@fynmanoj could you please reach out to @avikganguly01 to get him to review and merge this? To unblock you to rebase your PR. He can then review and merge your PR. (I'm trying to get the long list of Fineract committers to be more involved; there are too few active ones...)
@fynmanoj : Michael's PR merged.
This pull request seems to be stale.  Are you still planning to work on it?  We will automatically close it in 30 days.
/rebase
@fynmanoj you can rework this PR now... we would love to merge it for you when conflicts are resolved and it passes the build.

> need #1465 here to change it to run against `localhost`. But let's first get #1425 reviewed and merged already.

I'll continue working on this after #1494 is merged.

Build failed due to:

```
SavingsWorkbookPopulateTest > testSavingsWorkbookPopulate() FAILED
    java.lang.AssertionError: 1 expectation failed.
    Expected status code <200> but was <500>.
```

I suspect that is probably not related to the changes here, so I'll close and re-open this to see if it "goes away". I've also created FINERACT-1256 to track if this happens more often.
LGTM! Concerning enabling more bugpatterns I totally agree.

@vidakovic voilà! Phew. Do you want to review and merge this? Other committters welcome.. /Cc @ptuomola 

This intentionally has 2 commits (don't squash), as I needed #1498 for FINERACT-1256 as part of this here.
The same commit is also included as part of #1494, so I can close this if that gets merged.

Just wondering... do we want to make this the default behaviour? Or just something that is used when running integration tests? I personally think seeing the INFO would be OK as normal behaviour (as that's what people would expect to see from other Spring Boot apps) - and we would just turn it off for Integration Tests. But not sure how easy that is to achieve?
@rrpawar96 apparently this has conflicts that need to be resolved? @nikpawar89 once conflicts are resolved, is this good for you as is?
@percyashu thanks for merging this! Minor feedback: Use Merge with Rebase instead of Merge Commit next time, see https://github.com/apache/fineract#merge-strategy. OK for you? Just ask if not clear!

I thought about this, and while using it actually started liking it better like this, it's suddenly so... "quiet, and clean"! ;-) It also "feels" like it's "lighter" and"starts faster", although that's just "perception", of course. But YMMV. It's a bit like Maven (which verbosely logs everything it's doing) VS Gradle (which spews less logs). This also feels like it's more inline with our https://github.com/apache/fineract#logging-guidelines, notably the point about log levels. So my vote is on just changing this generally, not just for ITs, but I'm interested in how others feel about it.

> @rrpawar96 apparently this has conflicts that need to be resolved? @nikpawar89 once conflicts are resolved, is this good for you as is?

I am going to take a look again, @rrpawar96 @vorburger
@vorburger, the changes metioned are added

Also, I noticed `./gradlew integrationTest` is no longer a thing and the readme was not updated to that regards, I don't know since when that task was removed, I just think you might want to update the readme on how to run tests now.
@vorburger Thanks and it is clear.
What do other recently active commiters think re this - pro or con? @vidakovic @avikganguly01 @fynmanoj @percyashu  @awasum

> Also, I noticed `./gradlew integrationTest` is no longer a thing and the readme was not updated to that regards, I don't know since when that task was removed, I just think you might want to update the readme on how to run tests now.

That's since #1465; @vidakovic do you want to fix up the README? @xurror you could just raise a PR for it yourself as well? ;-)

I understand this does not resolve https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/FINERACT-1168 but I think this change only looks good if we can get https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/FINERACT-764. So, just a thought instead having a foreplay with this logging why not just package it with https://github.com/apache/fineract/pull/1444 or bring it in after.
But overall, I think it's a good fit though.

> Hi
> 
> Quick search for people who have had a similar problem comes up with this:
> 
> https://stackoverflow.com/questions/12429237/eclipselink-returns-entity-with-null-primary-key
> 
> In this case it was resolved by setting eclipselink.weaving.internal to "false"
> 
> Is this something you've already tried? If not, would it be worth giving it a go?

Unfortunately, that didn't fix but I'm looking at other solutions. I'm drafting this for now.

@ptuomola @vidakovic @percyashu @xurror @fynmanoj @avikganguly01 @vincent-fuchs @awasum any of you willing to review this, for FINERACT-1201? Once this is in, a few more such refactoring may be proposed, and ultimately I will then work on FINERACT-955 some day.

I'm reasonable confident that this won't break break any :smiling_face_with_three_hearts: the documents and images features, because in FINERACT-1218 I have contributed [new test coverage for all this stuff](https://github.com/apache/fineract/tree/develop/integration-tests/src/test/java/org/apache/fineract/integrationtests/client) (and since FINERACT-1209 those new tests DO actually run in our CI!), but of course careful human code review is always still a good idea... :smiling_imp:
@vorburger : Logstash scripts in some older implementations will break if we upgrade but that's fine.

@avikganguly01 do you think it's useful to have INFO logs and has any real world in your logstash? My experience in running Fineract.dev and using Google Error Reporting has been that all I ever look at and seem to care about is WARN and ERROR... (BTW note all the issues linked from FINERACT-932 which I've been able to find! Do you want to contribute fixes for some of them?)
@vidakovic can you review this and merge when the build passes? Hope you'll like... :smile:
@avikganguly01 would you like to review this?

@ptuomola @vorburger thanks, on it :) 
Sorry for delaying this long, I have been juggling between college exams, assignments and health :( 
I will be done with my finals on 28th and have a month-long holiday, and I would have plenty of time to commit daily!!
PS: I miss the summer days and lot of "productive" discussions with @vorburger @ptuomola and @xurror  :D

> Sorry for delaying this long, I have been juggling between college exams, assignments and health :(

Don't say Sorry! You have no "obligation" to continue contributing to this project (after your GSoC) - no stress! Best wishes for health.

> I will be done with my finals on 28th and have a month-long holiday, and I would have plenty of time to commit daily!!

But we are of course excited to hear from you! If you can make the time, we always love to hear from you.
The commit of this PR will also be included in an (upcoming update to) #1368, and we can either merge this here or there.
@ptuomola @vidakovic review and merge this?
@vidakovic @ptuomola review and merge this?

@ptuomola re-review this, better now? @vidakovic do you also want to co-pair-review this? Let's give Petri a chance to look it over, so don't merge, just LGTM; this one is a big enough change to warrant 4 extra eyes.. this was supposed to be "just adding a check" but turned into a fairly big refactoring! :smile:
This pull request seems to be stale.  Are you still planning to work on it?  We will automatically close it in 30 days.
I will merge this one. Is a test specifically testing this case?
@rrpawar96 did you still want to update this PR, or close it?
This makes sense. Just waiting for routine checks to pass on Travis. Thanks @vorburger

> > Travis CI - Pull Request Failing after 3m — Build Failed
> 
> ```
> CommandProcessingResult.java:50: error: no suitable constructor found for CommandProcessingResult(Long,Long,Long,Long,Long,Long,String,Long,String,Map<String,Object>,Long,Long,Long,Boolean,Long)
> ```
> 
> @rrpawar96 did you notice this ^^^ build failure? Perhaps if you fix it @nikpawar89 will re-review this, so that we can merge it soon?

@rrpawar96 per our last conversation, you were testing this code. Is this PR stale, could you please check. @vorburger  I will have a final look, once @rrpawar96 completes testing, if you have any additional feedback, please feel free to mention here.
After creating this pr, there are a lot of changes that happened, so will do the functional testing of this PR with the UI and when it will be ready to fully re-review, will let you know.
Comments have been addressed and pr is been updated.
This pull request seems to be stale.  Are you still planning to work on it?  We will automatically close it in 30 days.
This pull request seems to be stale.  Are you still planning to work on it?  We will automatically close it in 30 days.

> After creating this pr, there are a lot of changes that happened, so will do the functional testing of this PR with the UI and when it will be ready to fully re-review, will let you know.

@rrpawar96 if you do not want this PR to be reviewed and merged yet, could you _Mark it as Draft_ (click button on the right?).
@vorburger - now that we turned off the automagic spotlessApply, looks like you need to run it manually for this one...

@vorburger just to be clear, I'm happy either way... haven't tried this to see how much cleaner it is, but at the same time I don't think there's a huge amount of useful information in the INFO logging either.

@awasum, @vorburger , @ptuomola 

I am going to make sure this will be done asap.

new pull request made

https://github.com/apache/fineract/pull/1536
@vorburger @rrpawar96  I have done a functional test and this is working fine
@vorburger  do we need to ensure anything before merging PRs from renovate-bot given the build is passing?
this needs some code changes, making a PR for that.
@thesmallstar no it's fine, please just Go Ahead, and as a committer feel free to simply merge all such PRs, as long as they are 💚 green! PS: Great to see you're back, BTW!
@thesmallstar would you like to code review this, and merge it of you think that it's fine? It's time to inverse our roles now! ;-)
@ptuomola if I understand this one correctly, this is "take II" of #1264, for FINERACT-1052. Would you like to (re)review this?

From the recent comment of  @francisguchie  on [FINERACT-1070 ](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/FINERACT-1070)  it seems like the entire system is still not working correctly. The problem however I feel is related to the frontend (and pre-existed as from comment from awasum) and the original problem related to FINERACT-1070 is solved here. Hence, merging this.
Merging this, green build :- )
Merging this, green build :- )
We don't really have any tests for swagger except to check if swagger API documentation works(opens). Merging this, maybe we can revert if we find something breaks.
I am not very sure about this one, maybe @ptuomola you can review this?
Will take this one, from build-log it seems like a lot of functions are now deprecated.
This pull request seems to be stale.  Are you still planning to work on it?  We will automatically close it in 30 days.
@thesmallstar this is a follow-up to #1541 (thanks for your review & merge!), as per FINERACT-1070; merge this if it LGTY?
@vidakovic perhaps you would like to review & merge this one?
@thesmallstar  & @vorburger  please see https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/FINERACT-1070 i have done the tests
Functionally the messaging is greatly improved

@Wandji69 excited to see you contribute! But did you see that the Travis CI build failed for this PR? Do you require assistance to determine why? Please also read https://github.com/apache/fineract#pull-requests, and note that this PR will be ignored, and eventually (in 1-2 months) expire and be automatically closed.

Thanks @Vorburger for looking in to this. I really will need help on
looking into this error.

On my local it ran without any error that’s why I decided to submit the
first changes I had made even though I haven’t completed it yet.
-- 
Thanks
Collins C. Wandji

This pull request seems to be stale.  Are you still planning to work on it?  We will automatically close it in 30 days.

Hi @davidyaha  and @eitanfr . If you want to send a PR contributing to Fineract, then it makes sense to Open an issue on the Fineract JIRA here: https://issues.apache.org/jira/projects/FINERACT/issues/  before sending a PR in.. and make sure your PR includes one commit if possible. You can always squash your commits if you wanted to try a few thing before solving the problem. THat way it becomes very easy for us to review. Do you want to create an issue for this floating rate bug? It will be useful to others and then send a follow up PR fixing it?
@vorburger , Do you want to continue reviewing this one?

Documentation: https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/FINERACT/Documentation+to+use+Integrated+Credit+Bureau
It's ready to get merge @vorburger @nikpawar89 @awasum

Hi @y1zozulia  and @ysanko-tranzzo . Welcome to the Fineract upstream project. Your PR looks like it solves a real problem but I will like to ask you to create a JIRA ticket on the open source issue system here: https://issues.apache.org/jira/projects/FINERACT/issues/, this way we have a public description of the issue you are solving and can review this PR with more context. Also edit your PR to include the FINERACT-xxx issue name as oppose to your internal issue tracking number: DGB-627. After that, we will be able to review this PR and get it merged if everything looks Ok. Does this make sense to you all?

@Sugihiru , please can you assign this issue on JIRA to yourself: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/FINERACT-1281, if you cannot do that, please just comment on the issue you are solving here so that I can assign the issue to you so you get credit for your work.

Sorry, @awasum I've accidentally opened this PR... 😓 
There are a number of contributions we would like to make in the following weeks and I will make sure to follow the protocol and cherrypick each contribution.
Can I just open issues on JIRA freely? or do I need permissions to do so?
This pull request seems to be stale.  Are you still planning to work on it?  We will automatically close it in 30 days.

The server keeps throwing a HTTP 500 Internal Server Error even with the changes

```
SEVERE: The RuntimeException could not be mapped to a response, re-throwing to the HTTP container
org.springframework.web.client.HttpClientErrorException: 400 Not enough balance amount for requested amount plus fees!
at org.apache.fineract.interoperation.service.InteropServiceImpl.prepareTransfer(InteropServiceImpl.java:368)
```

Result from Postman : 
```
{
    "timestamp": 1609755895161,
    "status": 500,
    "error": "Internal Server Error",
    "message": "",
    "path": "/fineract-provider/api/v1/interoperation/transfers"
}
```
Do we need to goto tomcat 10? @ptuomola , @vorburger

This is failing with an error similar to what is on the JIRA ticket: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/FINERACT-887
Is there a recent change somewhere...? I wonder....
Thanks, @Sugihiru I have updated the file now

This fails because the new CS version became a little more strict: _'+' should be on a new line._ `OperatorWrap` 

@thesmallstar would you perhaps have any interest in picking this up?

> Do we need to goto tomcat 10? @ptuomola , @vorburger

We don't "need" to, no. Eventually it could be nice to, just because over time we want to "keep up".

But seeing that it doesn't "just work" (build log: `> Task :integration-tests:cargoStartLocal org.codehaus.cargo.container.ContainerException: Deployable [https://localhost:8443/cargocpc/index.html] failed to finish deploying within the timeout period [240000]. The Deployable state is thus unknown.`), I suggest that we Close and Ignore this, for now - just because we have _"bigger fish to fry"_.

### Renovate Ignore Notification

As this PR has been closed unmerged, Renovate will ignore this upgrade and you will not receive PRs for *any* future 10.x releases. However, if you upgrade to 10.x manually then Renovate will reenable minor and patch updates automatically.

If this PR was closed by mistake or you changed your mind, you can simply rename this PR and you will soon get a fresh replacement PR opened.
@Wandji69 your build here failed due to FINERACT-887, please watch that issue for progress.
This build here failed due to FINERACT-887; so we must first sort that out (and then rebase this).

This failed because, apparently the JMS API changed between v2 and v3.. if I had to guess, I would bet it's probably just the package change from `javax.jms` to whatever that new Jakarta package name is? Note `error: package javax.jms does not exist`. If I'm right, then this should be fairly trivial to fix to get this to pass - just bulk replace 'em all (in a new manual PR, extending this automated one)... any volunteers?
Thanks, @vorburger I will keep an eye.
